The More You Know
Heart Disease is the number one killer of men and women.
Did you know that if you quit smoking today, your risk of heart disease decreases to that of a non-smoker in just 3 years?
Gum disease increases your risk of a heart attack and stroke by 50%.
Laugh every day! Each time you laugh, the blood flow to your heart increases for up to 45 minutes!
7-8 hours of sleep a night is the optimal amount to reduce the risk of a heart attack
30 minutes a day (even three 10-minute intervals) will reduce the risk of a heart attack.
Consuming less than 1500 mg of salt a day will lower your blood pressure and your risk of heart disease and stroke!
Normal blood pressure is under 120/80 mmHg. Is yours controlled?
1 in 2 men will die from Heart Disease. 1 in 3 women will die from Heart Disease (this is actually 1 in 2 if you are African American).
Two-thirds of adults and one-third of children are overweight or obese.
Every minute, one American will die from a heart attack.
Every 25 seconds, one American will have a heart attack.
Stress increases the risk of a heart attack.
Secondhand smoke increases your risk of a heart attack.
Every year, stroke kills twice as many women as breast cancer. Learn the signs and call 911 if you believe someone is having a stroke!
